Detailed Description

Provides methods for accessing the display in a generic way. For the application developer it is recommended to use the class DeviceContext for drawing operations. Using the display device directly is possible but it is important to know, that this approach bypasses the APOXI window system.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum VirtualDisplay::Type
 

Describes the type of the display regarding how the pixels are represented.

Enumerator:
Monochrome  One byte describes 8 pixels.
Planes2  One byte of a plane describes 8 pixels, 2 planes and hence 4 colors are available.
Planes4  One byte of a plane describes 8 pixels, 4 planes and hence 16 colors are available.
Planes8  One byte of a plane describes 8 pixels, 8 planes and hence 256 colors are available.
BitsPerPixel8  One byte describes the color of one pixel.
BitsPerPixel16  Two bytes describe the color of one pixel.
BitsPerPixel24  Three bytes describe the color of one pixel.
BitsPerPixel32  Four bytes describe the color of one pixel.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

VirtualDisplay::VirtualDisplay (  INT  index = 0  ) 
 

Parameters:
index Index of the display.

VirtualDisplay::VirtualDisplay (  XYDIM  width,
XYDIM  height,
INT  bits_per_pixel,
BOOLEAN  planes = FALSE,
DDrvAtomPtr  buffer = 0
) 
 

Parameters:
width Width in pixels.
height Height in pixels.
bits_per_pixel Number of bits used per pixel.
planes Organization of display-buffer: TRUE means organized as planes, FALSE means organized as bits per pixel.
buffer If buffer is 0 (= default) the display-device uses the buffer provided by VirtualDisplayConfig::GetFrameBuffer. In APOXI it is possible to use virtual display-devices, which allow a device-context to drawing on a virtual display. For virtual display devices buffer must point to the display buffer, where the drawing operations should be done.

VirtualDisplay::VirtualDisplay (  Bitmap *  bitmap,
INT  bits_per_pixel,
BOOLEAN  planes = FALSE
)

void VirtualDisplay::AdjustBlitRect (  const Rect &  rect  )  [inline]

void VirtualDisplay::BitBlit (  XYDIM  dest_x,
XYDIM  dest_y,
const BitmapRes &  bmp,
const Rect &  clip_rect,
UINT8  trans_mode = 0
) 
 

Blits a bitmap on the specified position.

Parameters:
dest_x x-position where the bitmap should be blitted.
dest_y y-position where the bitmap should be blitted.
bmp Source bitmap.
clip_rect Clipping rectangle, so that it is also possible to blit only parts of the bitmap. Note: no check for the clipping rectangle is done, the parameters must be inside the available display area.
trans_mode Transformation mode.

void VirtualDisplay::BitBlit (  XYDIM  dest_x,
XYDIM  dest_y,
const BitmapRes &  bmp,
const Rect &  clip_rect,
UINT8  trans_mode = 0
)

void VirtualDisplay::DrawChar (  XYDIM  x,
XYDIM  y,
const Glyph &  glyph,
INT  height
) 
 

Draws a glyph at the position x and y. Note that no clipping is done, hence it is not allowed to invoke this method if the glyph is not fully visible.

void VirtualDisplay::FillRect (  const Rect &  rect  ) 
 

Fills a rectangle with the current set color. Note: no clipping is done, the parameters must be inside the available display area.

void VirtualDisplay::Init (  Bitmap *  bitmap,
INT  bits_per_pixel,
BOOLEAN  planes = FALSE
) 
 

void VirtualDisplay::Init (  XYDIM  width,
XYDIM  height,
INT  bits_per_pixel,
BOOLEAN  planes = FALSE,
DDrvAtomPtr  buffer = 0
) 
 

Parameters:
width Width in pixels.
height Height in pixels.
bits_per_pixel Number of bits used per pixel.
planes Organization of display-buffer: TRUE means organized as planes, FALSE means organized as bits per pixel.
buffer If buffer is 0 (= default) the display-device uses the buffer provided by VirtualDisplayConfig::GetFrameBuffer. In APOXI it is possible to use virtual display-devices, which allow a device-context to drawing on a virtual display. For virtual display devices buffer must point to the display buffer, where the drawing operations should be done.

void VirtualDisplay::Init (  Bitmap *  bitmap,
INT  bits_per_pixel,
BOOLEAN  planes = FALSE
)

virtual void VirtualDisplay::Refresh (   )  [virtual]
 

Refreshes the display area specified by the blitting-rectangle (see VirtualDisplay::SetBlitRect and VirtualDisplay::GetBlitRect) and resets the blitting-rectangle to an empty state.

Reimplemented in DefaultDisplay, Display, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, and DefaultDisplay.

void VirtualDisplay::SetBlitRect (  const Rect &  rect = Rect()  )  [inline]
 

Parameters:
rect Rectangle which describes the blitting rectangle. The blitting rectangle describes the area which is copied from the frame buffer to the phyisical display in VirtualDisplay::Refresh.
